original_solution_mapping.L1: After buying 3 pieces of gum Ariana has 10 + 3 = <<10+3=13>>13 pieces of gum.
original_solution_mapping.L2: After giving her 11 friends gum Ariana has 13 - 11 = <<13-11=2>>2 pieces of gum left.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7218.
    Returns: the number of pieces of gum Adrianna has now.
    """
    # L1
    initial_gum_pieces = 10 # 10 pieces of gum
    bought_gum_pieces = 3 # get 3 more pieces of gum
    gum_after_buying = initial_gum_pieces + bought_gum_pieces

    # L2
    friends_given_gum = 11 # gave out gum to 11 friends
    gum_remaining = gum_after_buying - friends_given_gum

    # FA
    answer = gum_remaining
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: After buying {bought_gum_pieces} pieces of gum Ariana has {initial_gum_pieces} + {bought_gum_pieces} = <<{initial_gum_pieces}+{bought_gum_pieces}={gum_after_buying}>>{gum_after_buying} pieces of gum.
After giving her {friends_given_gum} friends gum Ariana has {gum_after_buying} - {friends_given_gum} = <<{gum_after_buying}-{friends_given_gum}={gum_remaining}>>{gum_remaining} pieces of gum left.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: After buying 3 pieces of gum Ariana has 10 + 3 = <<10+3=13>>13 pieces of gum.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After giving her 10 friends gum Ariana has 13 - 10 = <<13-10=3>>3 pieces of gum left.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'initial_gum_pieces' (10) was used instead of 'friends_given_gum' (11).
